There's 2 way to answer that equation, 3 - x > 17, going by Pemdas magic, Subtract 3 from both sides, -x > 14 that's one of our answers, or we could multiple both sides by -1 to make x < -14, since 14 wasn't it became negative because of the -1 multiple, and two negatives makes a positive that's why -x became positive when it got multipled. Going for the process to help explain, 2x +9 < 4x +3, Going by Pemdas magic we subtract the +3 frist, 2x +6 < 4x, then we subtract 2x from both sides, +6 < 2x, then we divide both side by 2, 3 < x, however now we filp the entire equation as we like to read it like that, making our answer be × > 3, hope this helps! I solved it like this: 2x+9<4x+3 2x-2x+9<4x-2x+3 9<2x+3, subtract three from both sides to eliminate (3). 6<2x, now simply divide both sides by 2. 3<x  And you can also write it in the opposite way:  ×>3

When a variable is negative (-x), you'll have to multiple or divide by -1 to get x. When multiplying or dividing negative variables, the sign must be flipped.
because it isn't correct, put the number in and see the result

If 2X + 9 is less than 4X + 3 , then naturally 4X + 3 is greater than 2X + 9. 4X + 3 > 2X + 9 is just a different way to express X + X + X + X + 3 > X + X + 9. We can isolate the 9 by subtracting 2X from both sides. This leaves us with 2X + 3 > 9. The next step is to cancel out the 3 by subtracting it from both sides. Now we have 2X > 6. Dividing 2X by 2 gives us X, and dividing 6 by 2 gives us 3. In conclusion, X > 3.

Hi Eric.  The result says, but you use                x>3          x=2 That's the mistake, the solution requires it to be bigger than 3, and you're using 2.  I speak Spanish as well, if you need more help, I can gladly help you in Spanish as well

I know it's been several months but let me walk you through how I did it: If 2X + 9 is less than 4X + 3 , then naturally 4X + 3 is greater than 2X + 9. 4X + 3 > 2X + 9 is just a different way to express X + X + X + X + 3 > X + X + 9. We can isolate the 9 by subtracting 2X from both sides. This leaves us with 2X + 3 > 9. The next step is to cancel out the 3 by subtracting it from both sides. Now we have 2X > 6. Dividing 2X by 2 gives us X, and dividing 6 by 2 gives us 3. In conclusion, X > 3. I hope this is helpful.

@ispeakwhenimallowedto..3582  Another way to get the answer is by subtracting 3 from both sides first, which leaves 2X+6<4X. The next step would be subtracting 2X from both sides, which leaves 6<2X. To get the answer to X, you have to divide it by 2. To keep the expression accurate, we have to do the same thing to 6, so what's left is 3<X. If 3 is less than X, then X is greater than 3, which we write as X>3. 3<X = X>3.  X<-3 and X>-3 are different expressions entirely.

Step 1: Subtract both side with 3. Step 2: Subtract both side with 2x. Step 3: Divide both side with 2 and you will get 3<x.  Step 4: Flip the whole thing and you have x>3(unnecessary step).
​ @arpittripathi9472  So, since it is an unnecessary step, why is it there?

@TheSnowyOwl-zg2ck   a > b  Also means  b < a  3 > 2 means  2 < 3  Usually it doesn't matter, but it's easier to read if the variable is on the left side.   So if you get  3 < x you can just say  x > 3.  3 is smaller than x x is bigger than 3  All means the same thing.   Also, notice how equalities don't have this issue: a = b means b = a the sign is symmetrical.
@arpittripathi9472  tysm
yes. but if you do that, flip the signs: a > b  is the same thing as  b < a  notice that the sign is flipped. examples:  x < 5 Also means 5 > x  9 > 3 Also means  3 < 9
